posts.name: Santiago Sepúlveda
posts.cooked: Hi everyone, hope you are having a good offseason. I’m currently working on a DIY LED controller for FRC . I have decided to base it on the WLED library for the ESP32 due to it’s robustness, ease of use, and number/quality of animations. I’m trying to get the RoboRio and ESP32 to communicate. WLED supports HTTP requests and this has been my go to communication method with things like RaspberryPi. I was wondering if the RoboRio was capable of sending these requests in it’s local network. Thanks in advance

posts.name: Peter Johnson

link_counts.title: Add LED pattern API for easily animating addressable LEDs by SamCarlberg · Pull Request #6344 · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub

posts.name: Santiago Sepúlveda
posts.cooked: Great! I did see the new library is coming, but I love WLEDs support for non conventional led layouts like matrix and rings. I also wouldn’t like to take up any more RoboRio procesing power than necesary. We will 100% try out the new library

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked: I used this code to communicate with GRIP about 4 years ago. It was too slow for responsive vision processing but to light LED it’s probably fine even if slow and with today’s equipment it might not be slow. This example is the opposite of what you want since I presume you want to PUT (or POST if you are trying to duplicate their curl examples).

posts.name: Santiago Sepúlveda
posts.cooked: Thank you! Glad to know I wasn’t too lost on the implementation. And yeah, network tables is the only reasonable data transfer system with vision data, timewise. Everything just sets and gets the values they need, when they need.
